newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar ends lower and within range.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar ends lower and within range.

text.p: CSCE world sugar futures settled a lackluster session weaker, but prices maintained their recent range with the trade cited on both sides of the market, dealers said.
Early buying carried spot July to the top of a gap, where producer and speculative selling emerged to block further gains.

The selling pressured the front month beneath Tuesday's low of 10.76 to a low of 10.75 cents, but failed to push the contract to 10.65 cents, the low hit on May 2. Further speculative liquidation is expected to emerge below that level, traders said.
Resistance remained at today's high of 10.92 cents.
Open interest in July stood at 74,334 lots, up 266 lots, as of early Tuesday.
July ended down 0.12 to 10.76 cents per lb, having ranged from 10.92 to 10.75 cents. The rest of the board settled 0.08 lower to 0.01 firmer.
Volume was estimated at 12,504 lots, compared with Tuesday's official 7,449 lots.
Analysts viewed today's close as negative, and said July could slip under support on Thursday.
